metadata.Title: CVE-2018-11039 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Spring Framework (versions 5.0.x prior to 5.0.7, versions 4.3.x prior to 4.3.18, and older unsupported versions) allow web applications to change the HTTP request method to any HTTP method (including TRACE) using the HiddenHttpMethodFilter in Spring MVC. If an application has a pre-existing XSS vulnerability, a malicious user (or attacker) can use this filter to escalate to an XST (Cross Site Tracing) attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-11039` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-aop-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-beans-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-context-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-context-support-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-core-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-expression-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-instrument-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-jdbc-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-jms-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-messaging-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-orm-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-oxm-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-test-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-transaction-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-web-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-web-portlet-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-web-servlet-java - 4.3.19-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libspring-java package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.19-1').
